question_sentence: Which signature drink did Starbucks reintroduce to its menu this week?
evidence: Starbucks’ beloved Pumpkin Spice Latte is back. The signature drink returned to the fall menu on Thursday, marking its 20th anniversary.

question_sentence: Which streaming platform announced new price increases this week for millions of users?
evidence: Netflix has raised its prices again. The company’s stock surged following the price hikes and an announcement that the company saw a boost of over 8 million subscribers last quarter.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled more than 870,000 trucks because the parking brake could engage unexpectedly?
evidence: Ford recalled hundreds of thousands of F-150 trucks this week due to a parking brake issue. So far, the automaker is aware of 299 instances of the parking brake activating unintentionally, including at least 19 while the vehicle was being driven.

question_sentence: Roughly how many student loan borrowers recently received inaccurate bills?
evidence: The Department of Education announced about 300,000 student loan borrowers recently got monthly bills with the wrong amount — many with charges higher than they should be.

question_sentence: Who, according to a new poll, is the United States’ most popular public figure?
evidence: The Prince of Wales is a hit across the pond, topping a Gallup survey that asked Americans for their views on 15 prominent public figures. Prince William was the strongest candidate, with 59% of the vote, ahead of the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, at 57%. Donald Trump was in sixth place with 41%.

question_sentence: Phone networks and internet connections were down for millions Wednesday in which country?
evidence: Australia’s second-largest telecommunications provider experienced an unexplained nationwide outage, creating chaotic service disruptions. Train networks, rideshare companies, banks and hospitals across the country were impacted for hours.

question_sentence: A Rightmove analysis suggests having the "unlucky" number 13 on the front door knocks how much off a property's value?
evidence: Analysis of data from valuations of more than 10 million UK properties found that while the average price was £360,126, "unlucky" properties were worth £354,793. By contrast, homes with the lucky number seven typically had an above-average estimate of £365,590.

question_sentence: What led to the resumption of the defamation lawsuit against Lauren Witzke?
choices: The defendant, Eric Vaughn, dropped the lawsuit.
New evidence emerged that supported Eric Vaughn's claims.
A Texas judge reversed her previous ruling
Lauren Witzke publicly apologized for her statements.

question_sentence: What is the name of a fugitive Pennsylvania pig caught after 18 days on the run?
evidence: The elusive hog was eventually caught using a cinnamon bun filled with Benadryl, after a lengthy search by his human family. The pig's namesake even helped, with the actor posting social media pleas to "bring Kevin Bacon home". For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which former NFL star announced he will become a college professor at his alma mater this fall?
evidence: Former NFL and University of Tennessee star quarterback Peyton Manning is returning to his alma mater to teach at the school’s College of Communication.

question_sentence: British Vogue editor-in-chief Edward Enninful will be replaced by who after stepping down next year?
evidence: Following months of speculation, Condé Nast has confirmed that London-born Nnadi, currently editor of the US Vogue website, will take the reins of the UK magazine from next March. The 44-year-old will be the publication’s first black female editor.

question_sentence: Which small intruder crawled through a fence at the White House this week, prompting a swift response from the US Secret Service?
evidence: A toddler infiltrated White House grounds, setting off security alerts. The young boy was caught by officers before being quickly reunited with his parents.

question_sentence: The NHS is "repurposing" breast cancer treatment Anastrozole as a preventative pill after the drug was found to cut post-menopausal women's risk of the disease by how much?
evidence: Anastrozole has been available for years as a breast cancer treatment, but will now be offered to tens of thousands of women as a preventative option after becoming the first drug to be relicensed as part of NHS England's Medicines Repurposing Programme. The 4p-a-day pill will be offered to women with a moderate to high risk of developing the disease, which is the most common cancer in the UK.

question_sentence: Thousands of online communities went dark this week to protest API changes on which social media platform?
How much did “Barbie” take at the global box office in the new film’s opening weekend?
evidence: Greta Gerwig’s “Barbie” claimed the top spot as the highest-grossing film of the year, raking in $162 million in the US and Canada alone.

question_sentence: More than half of US adults claim to have been visited by what in a dream, according to a new survey?
evidence: In a Pew Research Center survey of more than 5,000 people, 53% reported being visited by a deceased family member in a dream or some other form. For more stories from the stranger side of life, get The Week’s Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: What enabled Anthony Papiro, a visually impaired runner, to qualify for the Delaware high school cross country championship meet?
choices: The use of a guide runner during races.
His participation in the wrestling team before transitioning to running.
The gene therapy injections he received to stabilize his vision.

question_sentence: North Korea's Kim Jong Un is believed to have celebrated which big birthday this week?
evidence: Kim Jong Un is believed to have been born on 8 January 1984, although North Korea has never confirmed the exact date. He has been supreme leader of the hermit state since the death of his father, Kim Jong Il, in 2011.

question_sentence: Infestations of which unwanted pest are causing panic across Paris?
evidence: Viral videos on social media appear to show bedbugs swarming inside the French capital's trains, subways, buses, cinemas and even at Charles-de-Gaulle airport. The authorities are under pressure to tackle the infestations before the city hosts the Olympics next summer, but experts say the tiny insects are on the rise worldwide.

question_sentence: Which college sport set a world record for attendance this week?
evidence: Over 92,000 people attended the University of Nebraska women’s volleyball match against Omaha — setting a world record for the largest announced crowd at a women’s sporting event.

question_sentence: What inspired the name and design of the vintage coin-operated kiddie ride "Champion" at Funland in Rehoboth Beach?
In the first half of 2023, Delaware saw a significant increase in legal abortions compared to 2020. What percentage increase did Delaware experience during this period?
Which professional golfer won the 2023 Masters Tournament?
evidence: Jon Rahm won the 2023 Masters Tournament on Sunday at Augusta National Golf Club, clinching his first green jacket and second career major.

question_sentence: Which animal made an unexpected appearance at Disney World this week, prompting the temporary closure of several rides?
evidence: A bear that prompted partial closures at Walt Disney World’s Magic Kingdom on Monday was captured without incident and is being relocated.

question_sentence: Which US institution this week released its first-ever code of conduct?
evidence: The most powerful legal body in the US has issued ethics rules governing its nine justices amid increasing scrutiny following reports of undisclosed property deals and gifts. In a one-sentence press release, the court said the code was merely the "codification of principles that we have long regarded as governing our conduct".

question_sentence: What is the planned development across from Helen's Sausage House near Smyrna on Route 13?
choices: A new park and recreational area.

question_sentence: Joe Biden hosted an early screening of which upcoming film at a Thanksgiving event for US service members and their families?
evidence: The president and First Lady Jill Biden kicked off the Thanksgiving holiday week with a visit to naval installations in Virginia, where they shared a "friendsgiving" meal with service members and their relatives after welcoming youngsters to a screening of the upcoming film about Roald Dahl's fictional chocolatier Willy Wonka. Introducing the movie, the president told the audience that "I like kids more than adults", and added: "I wish I could stay and watch 'Wonka' with you."

question_sentence: Health officials anticipate a new Covid-19 vaccine will be released in the US by which month?
evidence: The new Covid-19 vaccines, which should be ready by the end of September, will be made available directly from the manufacturers on the commercial market, rather than through the US government.

question_sentence: Which group of countries recently announced a surprise move to slash oil production, fueling fears of higher gas prices?
evidence: OPEC, which supplies a large portion of the world’s crude oil, announced it will cut production by more than 1.6 million barrels a day starting in May – a move that sent oil prices surging this week.

question_sentence: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan alleged photographers dangerously pursued them for hours this week through which city?
evidence: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan were involved in a chaotic car chase with paparazzi in New York on Tuesday that could have resulted in a “catastrophic” outcome, their spokesperson has alleged.

question_sentence: Who is Wally, and why did he attend the Philadelphia Flyers' game against the Carolina Hurricanes?
choices: Wally is the Flyers' new mascot who was introduced at the game.
Wally is a professional hockey player for the Flyers.
Wally is an emotional support alligator who attended the game with his owner, Joseph Henney.
Wally is a popular singer who performed at the game's halftime show.

question_sentence: Police Scotland is facing a flood of complaints from officers over a new policy requiring them to do what?
evidence: Belgium’s Brecel claimed a 18-15 victory over four-times winner Selby in the World Snooker Championship final at Sheffield’s Crucible on Monday.

question_sentence: Which car company has publicly criticised Rishi Sunak’s decision to delay the UK’s 2030 ban on new petrol and diesel cars?
evidence: The company’s UK chair, Lisa Brankin, said the 2030 target had been a "vital catalyst to accelerate Ford into a cleaner future“. Pushing back the non-electric car ban to 2035 would “undermine” the government’s “ambition, commitment and consistency”, Brankin warned.

question_sentence: Former president Donald Trump pleaded not guilty to how many felony counts of falsifying business records when he appeared in a New York court this week?
evidence: The indictment makes Trump the first ex-president in US history to face criminal charges. The case against him centres on an alleged $130,000 (£105,000) payment made to adult film star Stormy Daniels during the final days of the 2016 presidential campaign.

question_sentence: British pop star Ed Sheeran was in court this week after being accused of copying which hit song from 1973?
evidence: Ed Sheeran took the stand this week in a high-profile copyright trial about whether his smash single “Thinking Out Loud” copied Marvin Gaye’s hit “Let’s Get It On.”

question_sentence: Argentina's newly inaugurated President Javier Milei devalued the peso by how much as part of his economic "shock therapy"?
evidence: Milei is slashing the value of Argentina's currency, the peso, against the US dollar as part of emergency measures to help the nation's struggling economy. The far-right president has also announced massive spending cuts since being sworn in on Sunday.

question_sentence: Italy’s Supreme Court has ordered a city council in Lombardy to pay a couple €50,000 (£43,000) for failing to safeguard them against what?
evidence: The landmark ruling concludes a 10-year legal case in which the couple sought the right to “a quiet life” and “rest” at their home in Carmine, a district with bustling nightlife in the northern city of Brescia.

question_sentence: Which carrier is merging with Alaska Airlines?
evidence: Alaska Airlines announced it will buy rival Hawaiian Airlines for $1.9 billion. The unique deal will see both companies keep their existing brands.

question_sentence: Several powerful tornadoes struck the US this week, leaving thousands without power and some trapped inside shelters. Which state appeared to be the hardest hit?
evidence: The storms were reported across Oklahoma, Kansas and Iowa, with the most damage reported in Oklahoma, according to officials. At least four confirmed tornadoes moved across the state and knocked out power for about 20,000 homes and businesses.

question_sentence: Which US state became the 24th to legalise recreational marijuana?
evidence: More than 2.1 million Ohio voters, or 57%, this week approved a measure legalising recreational marijuana, defying Republican legislative leaders who had failed to pass the proposed law. The passage of Issue 2 allows adults over the age of 21 to use, purchase and possess the drug for non-medical purposes.

question_sentence: The US government is relaunching a program that will provide which item to American households at no expense?
evidence: US households will be able to order up to four free Covid-19 tests starting Monday.

question_sentence: In which nation did every citizen officially become one or two years younger this week?
evidence: On Wednesday, the East Asian country enacted a new law scrapping a centuries-old system that deemed children to be one year old at birth, with a year added every 1 January – meaning a baby born on 31 December would turn two the next day. A separate system, under which babies were zero at birth but turned one on 1 January, has also been abolished.

question_sentence: A 14-year-old won the title of America's Top Young Scientist for developing a soap that treats what?
evidence: Teenager Heman Bekele, from Annandale, Virginia, developed a compound-based soap that treats melanoma, the most common cancer in the US. His Skin Cancer Treating Soap (SCTS), which costs only 50 cents to make per bar, earned him a prize of $25,000.

question_sentence: What is the name of SpaceX's rocket, which exploded shortly after lifting off on its first test flight this week?
The US government is opening a public portal for Americans to report which kind of sightings?
evidence: The Pentagon is preparing for a flood of new reports as it readies two new portals for sightings of unidentified anomalous phenomena, more commonly known as UFOs.

question_sentence: What percentage of US adults have received the latest Covid-19 vaccine?
evidence: Just 19% of adults and 8% of children have gotten the latest Covid-19 vaccine, CDC data shows. This comes as respiratory virus activity is high and rising across the US.

question_sentence: Which African country did King Charles and Queen Camilla visit this week?
evidence: Charles became the first member of the British royal family to convey "sorrow" over Britain's violent repression of the Mau Mau uprising against colonial rule. At a State banquet in Nairobi on Tuesday, the King expressed "deepest regret" for the "wrongdoings of the past", but stopped short of an apology.

question_sentence: Which state was sued by the Justice Department this week over the construction of a barrier along the US-Mexico border?
evidence: The Justice Department is suing to force Texas to remove floating barriers in the Rio Grande, which Gov. Greg Abbott has argued is intended to deter migrants from crossing into the state from Mexico.

question_sentence: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis officially kicked off his 2024 presidential campaign on Tuesday in which state?
evidence: DeSantis made his first campaign appearance in Iowa, where he pledged to take on Washington insiders and do more for Americans than his GOP rival, former President Donald Trump.

question_sentence: Where did the second Republican presidential debate take place?
evidence: Wednesday night’s showdown took place at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, California. Seven GOP contenders were on the debate stage, but former President Donald Trump — the party’s front-runner — skipped the event.

question_sentence: Which type of recalled food was mistakenly distributed to several large retailers?
evidence: Several large retailers in the US — including Publix, Walmart and Aldi — received recalled fruit, the FDA warned Tuesday. The batches of non-organic peaches, plums and nectarines have been linked with a Listeria outbreak that caused at least one death.

question_sentence: All of these companies were included in Fortune’s “Best Companies to Work For” in 2023 except:
Fans and Hollywood stars are paying tribute to actor Matthew Perry following his untimely passing. Which popular TV sitcom did Perry star in?
evidence: Matthew Perry was best known for his role as Chandler Bing on “Friends.”

question_sentence: A surge of migrants at the US-Mexico border is expected next week when a Trump-era policy expires on May 11. What is the policy called?
evidence: A surge is expected when Title 42 — the Trump-era policy that allowed authorities to quickly turn away certain migrants at the border during the pandemic — comes to an end.

question_sentence: Which political figure froze for 30 seconds during a news conference this week, sparking renewed concerns about his health?
evidence: Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell told reporters he’s “fine” after freezing during a news conference on Wednesday. McConnell has declined to explain why he froze up, though an aide said he was feeling light-headed.

question_sentence: A Spanish TV star sparked controversy by using whose sperm for her surrogate baby?
evidence: Ana Obregón has been the focus of public debate since having a baby girl via surrogacy (which is illegal in Spain) in the US, using the sperm of her son Alessio, who died of cancer in 2020 at the age of 27. The 68-year-old TV presenter told Hola! that her son’s “dying wish” was to have a child, so the baby “isn’t my daughter, but my granddaughter”.

question_sentence: What does the phrase “bagging up” mean in Delaware slang?
choices: To describe laughing or shared laughter
To pack one’s bags and leave

question_sentence: Dolly Parton broke the Guinness World Record for the most studio albums by a female country singer with how many releases?
Which popular video game is being developed into a live-action film?
evidence: The popular video game “The Legend of Zelda” is coming to life in a new live-action movie, Nintendo announced.

question_sentence: The president of which African country travelled to China this week to ask for a $1 billion loan?
evidence: President William Ruto requested the funds in order to complete "white elephant projects" in Kenya. He was also prepared to "beg for more time to settle more than $8 billion in existing loans from China", said The Times. To find out more, tune in to the latest episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Federal prosecutors this week charged Rep. George Santos with which of the following:

A deep-sea submersible captured international attention when it went missing in the North Atlantic Ocean. Days later, authorities said the sub had suffered a “catastrophic implosion” and all five people onboard were killed. What was the sub’s name?
evidence: The Titan sub was on an excursion to explore the wreckage of the Titanic.

question_sentence: Catholic nuns in which US state have banned their bishop from their monastery for their “spiritual safety”?
evidence: The Discalced Carmelite Nuns of Arlington said they “no longer recognise the authority” of Bishop Michael Olson, who they accuse of aggression and spiritual manipulation. The long-running row began when he accused their Mother Prioress of violating her vow of chastity by “sexting” a priest.

question_sentence: Which Major League Baseball team did Zack Gelof get called up to play for?
A US zoo apologised to which country over the mistreatment of a bird?
evidence: Viral footage showed visitors at Florida’s Zoo Miami patting a kiwi, a nocturnal bird, under bright lights during a $25 “Kiwi Encounter” experience. The zoo apologised for having “offended a nation” following an outcry in New Zealand, where kiwis are a treasured national icon.

question_sentence: America’s banking system was widely impacted this week by which issue?
evidence: Since last week, frustrated customers have reported direct deposit payment problems at Bank of America, Chase, US Bank and Wells Fargo, to name a few.

question_sentence: Scotland’s Orkney islands are considering proposals to become a territory of which country?
evidence: Orkney could leave the UK and become a territory of Norway under new proposals to explore “alternative forms of governance” that could provide more economic opportunities. The islands were under Norwegian and Danish control until 1472

question_sentence: The United Nations commemorated World Refugee Day on Tuesday. According to UN estimates, approximately how many refugees are there worldwide?
evidence: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees estimates the number of refugees worldwide is approaching 35 million people — although that number does not include the millions of forcibly displaced people who have not been granted refugee status.

question_sentence: What issue is currently preventing the opening of the Lidl store in Bear, Delaware?
What is the name of the storm that has battered Britain this week?
evidence: Flights were grounded, with train services also disrupted and major incidents declared in parts of the UK, as the storm made landfall on Thursday. Tens of thousands of homes were left without power amid widespread flooding and damage, with 100mph-plus winds recorded.

question_sentence: Why will Winter WonderFest not be opening this year, according to the news article?
choices: Financial challenges led to the closure
It was not popular with the community
The event organizers wanted to change its location

question_sentence: What key recommendation was made in the independent assessment of Delaware’s education funding system?
choices: Increase overall state investment in public education.
Simplify the calculation of the local share provided to charter schools.
Implement a weighted student funding formula for the state.

question_sentence: What NHL team in its sixth season routed the Florida Panthers 9-3 this week to capture its first-ever Stanley Cup title?
What was the most-viewed page on Wikipedia this year?
evidence: ChatGPT, the viral AI chatbot, was the most-viewed page on Wikipedia this year with nearly 50 million views, reflecting the world’s interest in artificial intelligence.

question_sentence: Diane Abbott suggested in a letter to which newspaper that Jewish, Irish and Traveller people are not “all their lives subject to racism”?
evidence: Abbott subsequently issued an apology, claiming that an early draft of her letter had been mistakenly published. She has been suspended from the Labour Party pending an investigation.

question_sentence: The NFL announced which service will air the first exclusively live streamed NFL playoff game for 2023 season?
Who is now CEO of OpenAI following Sam Altman's sacking from the role last week?
evidence: The OpenAI co-founder was ousted as CEO of the Silicon Valley giant last Friday and was hired by Microsoft the following Monday to lead a new artificial intelligence unit. But after OpenAI employees rallied behind Altman and threatened to resign, the company's board reinstated him to his original post.

question_sentence: Which UK parcel delivery company delivers the worst customer service, according to a new study?
evidence: A Citizens Advice-commissioned survey of more than 8,000 people found that more than one in three had experienced a delivery problem with the last parcel they received. Evri, formerly Hermes, was reported to be the worst provider, followed by Yodel.

question_sentence: As the war in Ukraine grinds toward another winter, Russia may be looking to which country to replenish its ammunition?
evidence: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un may travel to Russia to meet President Vladimir Putin for discussions on a potential deal to supply Moscow with weapons for its war on Ukraine, according to the US government.

question_sentence: Which country completely shut down its airspace for several hours this week to replace malfunctioning electrical equipment?
evidence: The Philippines briefly shut its airspace in a bid to tackle recent airport outages. In this year alone, two major outages at the airport caused widespread chaos with hundreds of flight cancellations affecting tens of thousands of passengers.

question_sentence: The prime minister of which country joined tens of thousands of women and nonbinary people in a one-day strike this week?
evidence: Prime Minister Katrin Jakobsdóttir called on female members of her cabinet to join in Tuesday’s strike – "kvennaverkfall" in Icelandic – to push for an end to unequal pay and gender-based violence. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What significant changes are expected with the new Duck Creek Regional Library in Smyrna?
choices: The library will be nine times larger than the current Smyrna Library and will no longer be operated by the town.
The library will be smaller than the current Smyrna Library.
The library will be operated by the town of Smyrna with funds from the county.
The library will have the same size as the current Smyrna Library but with more meeting rooms.

question_sentence: Which potentially harmful ingredient has been banned from use in all California foods?
evidence: California has banned the use of four potentially harmful chemicals in food, including the common color additive red dye No. 3. This chemical is found in thousands of products and many popular candies.

question_sentence: Which of these women were featured in this year’s Sports Illustrated swimsuit issue?
South Korea passed a law this week banning the sale of what?
evidence: South Korea has passed a bill, with near unanimous support in parliament, that bans the breeding and slaughter of dogs for human consumption. The legislation ends a centuries-old tradition that has become hugely controversial both domestically and around the world.

question_sentence: Which broadcaster suspended commentator Laurence Fox for making "totally inappropriate" comments about a female journalist?
evidence: In a live interview with host Dan Wootton, the actor and political activist said of political journalist Ava Evans: "Show me a self-respecting man who would like to climb into bed with that." Wootton has also been suspended, after Fox released a screenshot of a private conversation between the two seemingly making light of the incident.

question_sentence: What is the name of the Canadian coffee and fast-food giant that has signed a multi-unit development agreement to open locations in New Castle and Kent Counties?
What was discovered on the White House grounds this week that prompted a multi-agency investigation?
evidence: Lab testing for a powdery substance found at the White House on Sunday came back positive for cocaine, a spokesman for the Secret Service said. The substance was found near the entrance to the West Wing, a location where staff-led tours of the White House pass through on their way into the building.

question_sentence: Who from Delaware was featured on the Food Network program “Worst Cooks in America” that began airing on Sunday, Jan. 7, 2024?
The Metropolitan Police has said it will no longer attend emergency calls linked to what type of incidents?
evidence: In a letter to health and social care bosses, Met Police commissioner Mark Rowley stated his intention to order officers not to attend mental health incidents from 31 August onwards. Rowley argued the move is necessary as officers are being “diverted from their core role of fighting crime”, calling the current situation “untenable”.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled nearly 2 million vehicles this week?
evidence: Tesla is recalling nearly all 2 million of its vehicles on US roads for an important Autopilot update.

question_sentence: Which Republican presidential candidate recently dropped out of the 2024 race?
evidence: Former Vice President Mike Pence suspended his campaign for president amid lagging poll numbers and financial challenges.

question_sentence: Which golfer this week became the latest to leave the PGA Tour for the Saudi-funded LIV Golf circuit?
evidence: The Spaniard had previously ruled out joining the Saudi-funded league, which began in 2021. But the world No.3 and two-time major winner changed his mind after agreeing a deal worth a reported £450 million.

question_sentence: What is one of the reasons cited by Delmarva Power for requesting the rate increase?
choices: Recent high inflation and increased repair costs caused by severe weather events.
To provide a bonus to employees for their hard work.

question_sentence: What contributed to Delaware win against Del State in college basketball?
choices: Delaware's dominant start in the first half.
Delaware's efficient scoring during the entire game.

question_sentence: Which word did Donald Trump use to refer to his political enemies during his Veterans Day speech?
evidence: During a nearly two-hour Veterans Day address in New Hampshire last weekend, the former US leader vowed to “root out” opponents who “live like vermin within the confines of our country”. His speech was condemned by critics including Joe Biden, who warned that Trump's rhetoric was reminiscent of that used by the Nazis.

question_sentence: After 35 years, the curtain fell for the final time on Broadway's longest-running musical this week. What is the show called?
Which major pharmacy chain filed for bankruptcy this week?
evidence: Rite Aid filed for bankruptcy after losing nearly $3 billion over the past six years.

question_sentence: Which state was devastated by a series of tornadoes that left more than 35,000 customers without power?
evidence: Tennessee officials are assessing the damage after tornadoes and strong thunderstorms roared across the state, leaving at least six dead and multiple buildings destroyed.

question_sentence: Which iconic band recently held its final concert in New York City after 50 years of touring?
evidence: Members of the American rock band KISS said goodbye at their final concert on December 2 at Madison Square Garden — the culmination of 50 years of touring.

question_sentence: What is the name of the hurricane that slammed into Acapulco, Mexico, this week?
evidence: Hurricane Otis dealt a devastating blow to Mexico’s coast after making landfall as a record-breaking Category 5 storm.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden made an extraordinary wartime visit this week to which country?
evidence: President Biden visited Israel in a dramatic show of support for the country as it works to eliminate Hamas, the Islamist group that controls Gaza.

question_sentence: According to marine researchers, which type of aquatic denizen has been increasingly detected in waters off New York and New Jersey?
evidence: Four great white sharks have been detected swimming off the coast in the past few weeks. They all appear to be making their annual migration from the Florida Keys up to the US Northeast and Canada, according to the nonprofit marine research group OCEARCH.

question_sentence: Which social media company received a deadline from the European Union this week to address false and misleading claims on its platform?
evidence: X, the social media company formerly known as Twitter, has been rife with misinformation about the Israel-Hamas war. The company was given 24 hours by the European Union earlier this week to address illegal content and disinformation regarding the conflict in the Middle East.

question_sentence: Which country successfully landed a spacecraft on the moon this week?
evidence: India on Wednesday landed its Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft on the moon, becoming only the fourth nation ever to accomplish such a feat.

question_sentence: The public have regained the right to “wild camp” in which English national park?
evidence: The National Park Authority this week won an appeal against a High Court ruling in January that visitors did not have the right to camp on Dartmoor without the landowners’ permission. The national park in Devon is the only place in England and Wales where wild camping is legal, under a decades-old local law.

question_sentence: Which major strike in the US ended this week?
evidence: The Hollywood writers’ strike is finally over after a tentative agreement was reached between union negotiators and major studios. All eyes have turned toward striking actors and autoworkers who remain on the picket lines.

question_sentence: Roller coaster riders in Wisconsin were recently trapped upside down for an extended period following a mechanical failure. About how long were some riders hanging upside down before the daring rescue?
evidence: The last passenger rescued had been upside down for more than three hours after the ride stalled. The ride has been temporarily closed while authorities investigate the terrifying ordeal.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives passed a bill this week to suspend the nation’s debt limit through which date?
evidence: The House voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday to pass a bill to suspend the nation’s debt limit through January 1, 2025, as lawmakers race to prevent a catastrophic default.

question_sentence: King Charles’s coronation procession route from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey covers a distance of how much?
evidence: The distance is far less than the nearly 4.5 miles covered in Queen Elizabeth II’s procession in 1953, triggered concerns that well-wishers hoping to line London’s streets to welcome the king may struggle to find space.

question_sentence: According to a newly published study, British parents increasingly view what as socially acceptable?
choices: Taking schoolchildren on holiday during term time
evidence: Research by Public First found that parental attitudes to school attendance had undergone a "seismic shift" since the pandemic. According to the consultancy firm, term-time holidays are increasingly viewed as "socially acceptable", as price hikes make summer breaks unaffordable for families hit by the cost-of-living crisis.

question_sentence: Why has Wilmington resisted reducing parking ticket costs?
choices: The city wants to increase the number of tickets it gives out.
It funds basic city functions with parking ticket revenue.
The parking enforcement officers lobbied against it.

question_sentence: Granger’s announcement came almost three years after the Emancipation Proclamation, the famous executive order abolishing slavery issued by which US President?
evidence: President Abraham Lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation on January 1, 1863, as the nation approached its third year of bloody civil war. The proclamation declared “that all persons held as slaves” within the rebellious states “are, and henceforward shall be free.”

question_sentence: Taylor Swift welcomed which special guest and "guiding light" to the premiere of her "The Eras Tour" concert film?
evidence: Swift paid tribute to the fellow pop superstar after they were snapped together at the premiere in Los Angeles on Wednesday night. "I'm so glad I'll never know what my life would've been like without @beyonce's influence," Swift wrote on Instagram, adding that the "Halo" singer has "been a guiding light throughout my career".

question_sentence: Which football conference will Delaware be joining in 2025 after moving up to the Football Bowl Subdivision (FBS)?
What percentage of the UK’s public toilets do experts estimate have closed in the past ten years?
evidence: Raymond Martin, managing director of the British Toilet Association, told The Guardian that the closure of half of the UK’s public loos in the past decade was resulting in street urination, also known as wild toileting, “everywhere now”.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden unveiled new efforts to crack down on which type of fees?
evidence: Biden announced new efforts to crack down on junk fees — the hidden or misleading fees that “companies sneak into your bill to make you pay more,” he said.

question_sentence: In a "world first," a new BMW 5-series sedan will perform what maneuver, using just the driver's eyes?
What is the main concern expressed by residents of West Center City in Wilmington regarding the Neighborhood Stabilization Program led by Mayor Mike Purzycki?
choices: Insufficient police presence and community engagement
Lack of improvement in housing conditions
Fear of gentrification and being priced out of the area
Limited access to information and communication from city leaders

question_sentence: An EU spat has broken out over Ireland’s plans to label which product with detailed health warnings?
evidence: Ireland will be the first country in the world to mandate labels on alcoholic drinks warning of the risks of cancer and liver disease and of drinking in pregnancy, and listing calorie content and grams of alcohol. EU members including France, Italy and Spain have asked the European Commission to investigate whether the move would contravene EU law.  Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: On July 4, 1776, the Continental Congress adopted the Declaration of Independence at a meeting in which city?
evidence: The Continental Congress adopted the Declaration of Independence while meeting in Philadelphia at the Pennsylvania State House – now Independence Hall.

question_sentence: Germany’s far-right Alternative für Deutschland (AfD) claimed its first ever victory in a district election where?
evidence: AfD candidate Robert Sesselmann claimed 52.8% of the vote in Sunday’s district council run-off election, beating the incumbent district administrator, from the centre-right Christian Democrat Party (CDU). The victory comes as national polls show a surge in support for the AfD.

question_sentence: Which country may be officially changing its name?
evidence: Various media outlets are reporting that India’s Modi government may soon put forward a resolution to officially change the country’s name to Bharat.

question_sentence: A priest was accused of desecration after he set up what in a 600-year-old church in Cornwall?
evidence: Rev Dr Nick Widdows defended the decision to install a mini bar in St Ia's Church ahead of the town’s annual September festival, saying that “this is just part of our way of welcoming all sorts of people into the church”. For more odd new stories, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: The leader of which southeast Asian country is handing power to his eldest son after ruling for almost four decades?
evidence: Hun Sen, who has been Cambodia’s prime minister since 1985, announced his resignation days after his party won a virtually uncontested general election. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which Salesianum School senior won the 215-pound title in the 30th edition of the Beast of the East wrestling tournament held on Sunday at the Carpenter Center?
Approximately how many books are being used to train artificial intelligence systems?
evidence: Almost 200,000 books are being used to train AI systems by some of the biggest companies in technology, according to a recent report. However, authors are outraged that their novels are being used without receiving permission or providing compensation.

question_sentence: The saliva of which animal could be the key to sprucing up your garden?
evidence: Isabella Tree, who runs the Knepp estate in West Sussex, told The Times that animal spit is the secret to growing fuller rose bushes. “If you collect some animal saliva, even if it’s pony spit or something, and anoint that little bit that you cut with your secateurs, the enzyme in the spit, the plant can read it and it goes even crazier,” she told the paper.

question_sentence: Why is former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visiting the University of Delaware this weekend?
choices: To attend a Democratic Party convention
To deliver a lecture on legislative history
To receive the 2023 Woman of Power and Purpose Award

question_sentence: A lottery ticket sold in which state won Tuesday’s $1.58 billion Mega Millions jackpot?
evidence: One ticket sold in Florida won the estimated $1.58 billion Mega Millions jackpot this week – expected to be the largest in the lottery’s history.

question_sentence: Which typhoon recently soaked Beijing with the city’s heaviest rainfall in 140 years?
evidence: Typhoon Doksuri dumped an entire month’s worth of rainfall on Beijing in only 48 hours, sparking rescue missions for survivors trapped by flooded streets.

question_sentence: The Church of England is selling off what kind of shares to “protect God’s creation”?
evidence: The Church of England is selling its investments in BP, Shell and other oil and gas giants because they do not “protect God’s creation”. Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby, a former oil industry worker, said the climate crisis “threatens the planet we live on”. For 10 things you need to know each day, sign up to the Daily Briefing newsletter.

question_sentence: The Republican National Committee (RNC) responded to Joe Biden’s re-election bid announcement by posting a video showing what?
choices: A simulation of Biden’s second term
A montage of clips from Donald Trump’s presidency
Republican voters’ reactions to the announcement
A series of unflattering clips from Biden’s first term
evidence: The video attack ad was created using artificial intelligence and depicts “a second Biden term plagued by disasters”, said Quartz.

question_sentence: True or false: It was announced this week that Prince Harry and Duchess Megan will be attending King Charles III’s coronation together.

Months after Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas came under scrutiny for accepting lavish trips paid for by a billionaire Republican donor, another justice is in the spotlight for similar reasons. Which justice is it?
evidence: Concerns about ethics and transparency at the Supreme Court have been reignited this week after Justice Samuel Alito acknowledged attending a luxury fishing trip on the private jet of a conservative hedge fund manager.

question_sentence: The risk of lightening strikes delayed this week’s launch of the European Space Agency’s Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (Juice) mission, which is due to reach the planet when?
evidence: Juice is due to spend at least three years exploring Jupiter and three of its moons. “Perhaps the most exciting information” that the mission will provide relates to the “underground oceans of liquid water” on these moons – Europa, Ganymede and Callisto – which “could support life”, said Mike Sori, assistant professor of planetary science at Purdue University.

question_sentence: In this week’s World Cup semi-final against Australia, which Lioness scored the decisive third goal?
evidence: The reigning European champions will play in their first ever World Cup final, taking on Spain on Sunday after defeating Australia 3-1. The game will mark the first time any senior England football side has reached a World Cup final since 1966.

question_sentence: Diwali, one of the biggest festivals in India, was celebrated this week with much fervor. What is the holiday also known as?
evidence: More than a billion Hindus, Sikhs, Jains and Buddhists around the world celebrated Diwali, also known as the festival of lights.

question_sentence: NASA's 16-person team of experts held a much-anticipated public hearing on UFOs this week. The panel is studying UAPs, which stands for what?
What percentage of British adults reportedly has an unfavourable view of campaign group Just Stop Oil?
evidence: The figure is up 15 points from 51% in April, according to polling from YouGov. Only 17% of British adults have a favourable view of the group Just Stop Oil, which has disrupted several major sporting events this summer.

question_sentence: Which type of structure recently collapsed in India, trapping dozens of workers?
evidence: Forty-one workers were rescued from a collapsed tunnel in India after a 17-day ordeal.

question_sentence: What is the main reason for Wilmington Mayor Mike Purzycki's proposal to eliminate the residency requirement for city employees?
choices: To save money on employee salaries
To encourage city residents to apply for city jobs
To address the housing crisis in Wilmington
To fill critical job vacancies in city departments

question_sentence: Iconic talk show host Jerry Springer died this week at 79. Before TV fame, he served a term as mayor of what city?
Which city will host the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
evidence: The 2024 Democratic National Convention will be held in Chicago, where the party will officially nominate candidates for president and vice president.

question_sentence: Workers in which field are resigning at an alarming rate in the US due to threats and harassment?
evidence: A growing exodus of local election officials is raising alarms ahead of the 2024 presidential contest. Many are leaving their local roles amid a spike in harassment and partisan interference in their duties.

question_sentence: Which singer is being blamed for higher than expected inflation in Sweden?
evidence: The start of the singer’s world tour in Stockholm last month triggered a spike in demand at hotels and restaurants that has now been linked to higher-than-expected inflation of 9.7% in May. For more odd and unexpected news, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: The Americans for Prosperity Action group is backing which Republican presidential candidate?
evidence: Founded by the billionaire Koch brothers, the Americans for Prosperity Action group this week announced its support for Haley, calling her a "candidate who can turn the page and win". Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which company is investigating a hack involving millions of user accounts?
evidence: Hackers have accessed nearly 7 million profiles of 23andMe customers, a spokesperson for the genetic testing firm told CNN, including some users’ ancestry reports, zip codes and birth years.

question_sentence: How much per year is Britain's obesity problem costing the economy, according to new analysis?
evidence: The research, commissioned by the Tony Blair Institute, found that the damaging effect on national productivity from excess weight was nine times bigger than previously thought. The total estimated cost to the economy is roughly 4% of the UK's GDP.

question_sentence: Scientists believe they have found the answer to high levels of radioactivity in which wild European animal?
evidence: Persistently high levels of radioactivity in Central Europe’s wild boars have long baffled scientists, as they have declined in other animals since the 1986 Chernobyl nuclear disaster. But a new study published in the Environmental Science & Technology journal appears to have solved the “wild boar paradox”.

question_sentence: Which country is set to become the 29th African nation to abolish the death penalty?
evidence: The West African country’s parliament has voted to abolish the death penalty, offering an expected reprieve for 176 condemned prisoners. If President Nana Akufo-Addo assents to the new law, Ghana will become the 124th nation in the world to outlaw the penalty.

question_sentence: Which pop star used their WhatsApp fan channel to criticise an AI-generated TikTok song that mimics their voice?
evidence: The Puerto Rican rap and reggaetón star – real name Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio – joins Drake and other artists in voicing concerns over AI-produced music. In a message posted on his WhatsApp channel on Monday, Bad Bunny said anyone who liked the soundalike song did not "deserve to be my friends".

question_sentence: Which film won five awards at the 2024 Golden Globes?
evidence: Christopher Nolan bagged the Best Director award with his hit movie, which also won Best Motion Picture, Best Drama Actor for Cillian Murphy, Best Supporting Actor for Robert Downey Jr, and Best Original Score for Ludwig Göransson's soundtrack. "Barbie", the highest-grossing global release of last year, won the first-ever Golden Globe for cinematic and box office achievement, plus Best Original Song for "What Was I Made For?" by Billie Eilish.

question_sentence: Which baseball veteran did the Los Angeles Angels hire to replace Phil Nevin as manager?
evidence: The 71-year-old is now the oldest manager in major league baseball and only the second active black manager, joining Dave Roberts of the Los Angeles Dodgers. Former Angels boss Nevin was not re-signed when his contract expired last month, after one and a half losing seasons in charge of the long-struggling team.

question_sentence: Donald Trump was attacked by what during a speech in Iowa this week?
evidence: The former US president swatted away flies during his address in Clive as he "went off on a tangent" and claimed that fly paper is illegal. "I didn't know you had flies in Iowa. I hate flies!" he exclaimed.

question_sentence: Why has New Castle County in Delaware become a hotspot for Mexican food, particularly known for its excellent carnitas and birria tacos?
choices: Delaware's lack of sales tax makes it an attractive location for Mexican immigrants.
The abundance of mushroom industry jobs in the area.
Mexican consul Carlos Obrador in promoting economic growth.
Delaware’s lack of sales tax and its welcoming political environment and the ability for undocumented Mexican immigrants to obtain legal driver's licenses.

question_sentence: Whose 2022 album has become Spotify’s most streamed of all time?
evidence: Puerto Rican superstar Bad Bunny has notched up another record with his fourth studio album, “Un Verano Sin Ti”, becoming Spotify’s most streamed album of all time. In 2022, the trap and reggaetón singer was the most streamed artist for the third consecutive year. He’s reached “a new stratosphere of stardom”, said Rolling Stone.

question_sentence: The U.S. embassy in which country was evacuated after intense fighting and military clashes this week?
Which Republican was elected as the new House speaker on Wednesday?
evidence: After weeks of party infighting, Louisiana Rep. Mike Johnson secured the speaker’s gavel without losing any Republican votes.

question_sentence: Which country is attempting to be the second nation to put people on the moon?
evidence: China is pursuing plans to land astronauts on the lunar surface before 2030.

question_sentence: Who was hired as the new police chief of Delaware State University?
Why was the woman in the story first put in prison?
choices: She was convicted of multiple crimes.
She refused to cooperate with the court's attempts to help her.
She had a lengthy criminal record in other states.
She violated the terms of her no-contact order.

question_sentence: What percentage of people in the UK dunk their sausage rolls in tea, in a finding which made the front page of the Daily Star?
evidence: One in 10 people said they dunk sausage rolls in their cup of tea, according to a study that has caused much upset for the Daily Star. The tabloid called the practice a “hideous habit” and further claimed that 4% of individuals, whom they referred to as “wrong ’uns”, engage in the act of dipping sandwiches into hot beverages – something the tabloid deemed nothing short of “evil”.

question_sentence: Which major Delaware craft brewery recently announced its closure after nearly 8½ years of operation in Smyrna?
A jury ruled British singer Ed Sheeran didn't plagiarize which classic 1970s tune when he created his hit song "Thinking Out Loud"?
choices: "Let's Get It On" by Marvin Gaye

question_sentence: Tens of thousands of people in China have left their homes in the past several days due to which damaging weather event?
evidence: Devastating flooding is ripping through southwest China, with several areas issuing the highest level of warnings to evacuate. Concerns are mounting that the floods will have a devastating impact on crops in the region.

question_sentence: Which lawmaker was ousted from his role as speaker of the US House of Representatives?
evidence: Kevin McCarthy was voted out as House speaker. The other lawmakers above have emerged as possible successors to take over the gavel.

question_sentence: According to internal documents reported this week, what measure is United Airlines planning to introduce this month to speed up the boarding of passengers?
choices: Stewards loading hand luggage in the cabin before passengers board
Asking passengers to complete safety briefings online before boarding
Only selling tickets for 95% of a plane's total passenger capacity
Allowing economy passengers with window seats to board first
evidence: United Airlines believes it could shave up to two minutes off the time it takes passengers to board a plane by asking those with aisle seats to wait until window-seat passengers have boarded.

question_sentence: A priest was accused of desecration after he set up what in a 600-year-old church in Cornwall?
evidence: Rev Dr Nick Widdows defended the decision to install a mini bar in St Ia's Church ahead of the town’s annual September festival, saying that “this is just part of our way of welcoming all sorts of people into the church”. For more odd new stories, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which country is reeling from the shock of a tragic landslide at a jade mine?
evidence: A landslide at a jade mine in northern Myanmar killed at least 32 people, a local fire services official told CNN on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Hackers threatened to leak stolen data from which tech company unless it pays a $4.5 million ransom and changes its controversial pricing policy?
evidence: Hackers from a ransomware gang are threatening to leak 80 gigabytes of confidential data from Reddit that they claim to have stolen during a February breach, according to a post from the group on the dark web, which was reviewed by CNN and an independent cybersecurity expert.

question_sentence: Which airline said this week it found loose bolts on several grounded Boeing 737 Max 9 planes?
evidence: Just days after an Alaska Airlines plug door blew off a plane mid-flight, United Airlines said it found loose bolts on an undisclosed number of the grounded Boeing 737 Max 9 planes in its fleet. All the Max 9 aircraft grounded by the FAA are undergoing inspections to ensure passenger safety.

question_sentence: Gun violence continued to plague communities across the US. Which state suffered the deadliest mass shooting in 2023?
evidence: A US Army reservist killed 18 people during a shooting rampage in October in Lewiston, Maine.

question_sentence: The CDC has recommended the new Covid-19 shot for everyone in which age group?
evidence: The CDC is recommending everyone 6 months and older get the new Covid-19 shot, which became available this fall.

question_sentence: Who won this year's Nobel Peace Prize?
evidence: The jailed Iranian women's rights activist was awarded the prize this week for her fight against the oppression of women in the country, and for her efforts in promoting human rights and freedom for all. The Nobel committee's decision to honour Mohammadi was widely applauded, but the awards have also triggered controversies over the years.

question_sentence: Sharon White is to step down as chair of John Lewis after how many years in the role?
evidence: White announced she is to step down – making her the shortest-serving chair in John Lewis's history – after the retail group posted a £234 million loss in the last financial year. To find out more, listen to The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which 2024 Republican presidential candidate was asked to stop using Eminem’s rap songs on the campaign trail?
evidence: Vivek Ramaswamy was asked to stop singing Eminem’s lyrics at campaign events after he gave an impromptu karaoke rendition of “Lose Yourself” at the Iowa State Fair.

question_sentence: Which grocery store chain recalled two types of cookies over concerns they may contain rocks?
evidence: Trader Joe’s announced a recall of two types of cookies, stating they may contain a foreign material — rocks.

question_sentence: What is the significance of Barratt’s Chapel and Cemetery?
choices: It is the oldest surviving cemetery in the United States.
It is the oldest surviving church building in the United States built by and for Methodists.
It is the oldest surviving building in the United States.

question_sentence: Which cruise line recently had a ship battered by an intense storm that left water and objects flowing down interior hallways?
evidence: The cruise ship Carnival Sunshine was rocked by a storm that caused interior water damage and delayed its return to port in South Carolina.

question_sentence: What is the focus of the early childhood innovation center proposed by Delaware State University near the Dover Mall?
choices: Redesigning traffic patterns in the area
Creating a new shopping complex for children's products
Improving access and support for early childhood educators
Developing a new theme park centered around childhood education

question_sentence: What prompted a Secret Service agent to open fire on Sunday in Washington's Georgetown neighborhood?
choices: An attempt to protect President Joe Biden.
An incident involving a break-in into a Secret Service vehicle assigned to protect Naomi Biden.
A security breach at the White House.
A suspicious package near the presidential motorcade.

question_sentence: Poland’s bus route 666 will now be known as what?
evidence: The operator of the bus route, which terminates at the Polish seaside resort of Hel, is making the name change following pressure from religious groups. For more odd and unexpected news, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: What is the title of the new movie that Teri Polo starred in, which was filmed in Delaware?
President Joe Biden welcomed which world leader to the White House for a state dinner this week?
evidence: Biden hosted Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the White House on Thursday for a lavish, tented state dinner that featured a plant-based menu for the guest of honor, who is a vegetarian.

question_sentence: According to Similarweb Digital Data, which clothing company is currently the most visited clothing website in the world, surpassing brands like Nike, H&M, and Zara?
Which university’s football team declined an invitation this week to the White House?
evidence: The Georgia Bulldogs football team declined an invitation to visit the White House next month to celebrate their second consecutive national championship, saying “the date suggested is not feasible given the student-athlete calendar and time of year.”

question_sentence: The English federation of which sport will defy new international restrictions on transgender competitors?
evidence: The English Chess Federation (ECF) has pledged not to enforce new rules introduced by the International Chess Federation (Fide) banning transgender players from women’s tournaments. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Video footage of a large brawl on a boat dock captivated the internet this week. Where did the fight occur?
evidence: At least three people have been charged in connection with a brawl at a riverfront dock in Montgomery, Alabama. The fight between the men, identified by authorities as White, and a Black co-captain of a riverboat, has turned a spotlight on the city’s racial history.

question_sentence: A Calvin Klein ad featuring which singer was banned for presenting her as "a stereotypical sexual object"?
evidence: The UK's Advertising Standards Authority (ASA) banned the advertising campaign after receiving two complaints that the images objectified women. The singer responded that the ruling revealed "double standards", coming in the wake of another Calvin Klein campaign starring a scantily clad Jeremy Allen White.

question_sentence: In addition to Halloween, which holiday was celebrated this week?
evidence: Mexico’s Día de los Muertos, or Day of the Dead, is a yearly celebration to remember and honor loved ones who have died. Day of the Dead always starts on November 1 and ends on November 2.

question_sentence: Which tech company is moving forward with its plan to delete accounts that have been inactive for at least two years?
evidence: Google plans to start deleting inactive accounts in December to prevent security risks. The company said it will send multiple warning notifications to impacted accounts and their backup emails before deletions begin.

question_sentence: Approximately how many people are still unaccounted for in the wake of Maui’s devastating wildfires?
evidence: The number of people still unaccounted for in Maui is “probably still over 1,000,” Hawaii Gov. Josh Green told CNN on Wednesday.

question_sentence: What year did Captain’s Catch Seafood open for business?
Which US president issued the first Thanksgiving proclamation?
evidence: On October 3, 1789, George Washington issued his Thanksgiving proclamation, designating “a day of public thanks-giving” to be held on “Thursday the 26th day of November” that year. Abraham Lincoln would later declare Thanksgiving as a national holiday in 1863.

question_sentence: In a two-year study, what dangerous sea creatures were observed by researchers swimming safely in very close proximity to humans?
What is the average cost of attending a hen or stag party in the UK, according to a survey for Aviva?
evidence: The research found that men spent £920 on average for celebrations in the UK, while women typically paid £652. For a stag or hen do abroad, men spent an average of £1,256, while women forked out £1,158.

question_sentence: Which animal is facing extinction in Wales due to a deadly virus?
evidence: A killer pox has killed up to 80% of red squirrels in one winter at the few sites they are still found in Wales. Nearly 11,000 people have signed a petition calling for the Welsh government to fund vaccine research in order to protect Wales’ small population of red squirrels – there are only about 1,000 left in North Wales. Invasive, non-native grey squirrels carry squirrel pox virus, but are not affected by it.

question_sentence: Who was the last former walk-on to become a Delaware football captain before Ethan Saunders in 2023?
President Joe Biden announced his bid for a second term this week, though polls consistently reflect concern about his age. How old is Biden?
evidence: At 80 years old, Biden is the oldest president in American history, and if reelected, he would be 86 when ending his second term. When pressed on his age during a news conference this week, Biden said he “took a hard look at it” before deciding to run and “feels good.”

question_sentence: Which country was devastated by an unprecedented attack this week by the Hamas militant group?
evidence: Israel formally declared war on Hamas on Sunday after the militant group launched a deadly surprise assault on the region, killing over 1,200 people. Hamas also took more than 150 hostages, officials say.

question_sentence: According to early polling, which candidate appears to be the most likely Republican nominee in next year’s presidential election?
choices: Former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley
evidence: Despite a plethora of legal woes, former President Donald Trump is the clear front-runner in the GOP race. Early polling suggests Trump currently has the upper hand over President Joe Biden in two critical battleground states — Michigan and Georgia.

question_sentence: Where will next month’s Republican presidential debate take place?
evidence: The third GOP presidential primary debate will be held on November 8 in Miami. It will be co-sponsored by the Republican Jewish Coalition, the group announced Monday. The decision comes amid the escalating violence in Israel and Gaza following the deadly attack by Hamas earlier this month.

question_sentence: The Commons privileges committee would have suspended Boris Johnson from Parliament for how long over Partygate if he were still an MP?
evidence: In a report published on Thursday, the privileges committee said that had Johnson not already resigned, he should have faced a three-month suspension for deliberately misleading MPs over Partygate.

question_sentence: What inspired Thomas Jackson to start his clothing line, "Carry My Own Weight"?
choices: A challenge to prove his friends wrong.
A childhood dream of owning a business.

question_sentence: Which two US presidents died on July 4 in the same year?
evidence: Thomas Jefferson and John Adams died within hours of each other on July 4, 1826. Jefferson was 83 and Adams was 90.

question_sentence: Which celebrity arrived at the Met Gala this week wearing the full animal suit pictured below?
According to the J.D. Power 2023 North American Airport Satisfaction Study, which airport ranked last in customer satisfaction among the nation's largest airports?
The Dutch prime minister Mark Rutte unexpectedly announced he would be stepping down after how many years in power?
evidence: Mark Rutte, the longest-serving Dutch prime minister in history, will stand down after 13 years in power. Nicknamed “Teflon Mark” for his ability to withstand political crises, Rutte unexpectedly announced he would leave politics after the autumn general election. In the 27-nation EU, only Hungary’s Viktor Orban has been in charge for longer.

question_sentence: The leaders of the Brics economic bloc met for a summit this week in which city?
evidence: The three-day summit was billed as the most important in a decade for the Brics bloc, comprising Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. Tensions have been mounting among the group, which together make up 40% of the world’s population, as China pushes for an expanded bloc to challenge the G7.

question_sentence: Which is the biggest national park in North America?
evidence: Northeast Greenland National Park is currently the globe’s single largest national park and biggest land-based protected area in North America. It is around 375,000 square miles, making it larger than most countries.

question_sentence: A new black comedy by controversial 90-year-old director Roman Polanski that premiered at the Venice Film Festival is called what?
evidence: Roman Polanski’s “name as a filmmaker is in the toilet”, said the Evening Standard, after “The Palace” was widely lambasted. Its inclusion at the Venice Film Festival had already sparked a backlash, as Polanski is still a fugitive from US justice after raping a 13-year-old girl in 1977. Find out more in The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: When does daylight saving time end in 2023?
Vietnam has banned the new Barbie movie over a scene showing what?
choices: A map of disputed Chinese territory
“Made in Vietnam” labels on shoddy clothing
evidence: Vietnam has banned commercial screenings of the Barbie film, out on 21 July, over a map that appears to show Beijing’s “nine-dash line” in the South China Sea that marks disputed territory. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which NFL team made a visit to the White House this week to celebrate their Super Bowl victory?
evidence: President Joe Biden welcomed the Super Bowl Champion Kansas City Chiefs to the White House Monday. See photos from the special occasion.

question_sentence: Former New Labour spin doctor Alastair Campbell has called for the introduction of primary school lessons in what?
evidence: Addressing an audience at the Hay Festival in Wales, Campbell said: “I think we should teach our kids to be interested in and engaged in politics.” The strategist and journalist added that rather than “call it politics”, such lessons could be called  “arguing”, “policy” or “big issues”.

question_sentence: Former President Donald Trump was indicted in Georgia this week for his alleged efforts to overturn his 2020 election defeat. How many times has Trump been indicted in total?
evidence: Donald Trump is the first current or former president in US history to face criminal charges. His 2024 presidential bid is going full steam ahead despite his four indictments.

question_sentence: Climate change is threatening to significantly impact the supply of which crop?
evidence: Climate change poses a huge threat to the coffee business and to farmers. Arabica coffee, the only variety used by Starbucks, is especially at risk.

question_sentence: Approximately how many refugees have been admitted to the US this year?
evidence: More than 50,000 refugees have been admitted to the US this year, according to the latest federal data. President Biden has set this year’s refugee ceiling at 125,000 and is considering raising the number of refugees who could be admitted to the US next year.

question_sentence: What sparked the popularity of Mexican pizza in Philadelphia?
choices: A chef's nostalgic return to his Italian restaurant roots
A local food competition promoting creative pizza recipes
The fusion of Mexican and Italian flavors by innovative chefs
The influence of Mexican-American fast-food chains
